pull.title: build: Bump VS minimum supported version to 18.0
pull.body: The new [VS 18.0](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/releases/2026/release-notes) release includes numerous bug fixes.

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Code Coverage & Benchmarks For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/33861. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | Stale ACK | [maflcko](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33861#issuecomment-3859093351) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore. ### Conflicts Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones: * [#34500](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34500) (ci: Print verbose Windows CI build failure by maflcko) * [#31974](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31974) (Drop testnet3 by Sjors) If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first. ### LLM Linter (âœ¨ experimental) Possible typos and grammar issues: - speedup -> speed up [verb phrase should be two words ("speed up") rather than the noun "speedup"; the current form is nonstandard in this context and may hinder clarity] 2026-02-10 15:41:41
Seems a bit premature, if this is still waiting for multiple pieces of unreleased software? Could just wait for it to be shown as fixed in a nightly build?

I guess there's no issue here with us assuming everyone compiling/developing on Windows is using an editor that is < 3 months old (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/releases/2026/release-notes#november-update-1800)?

Also, according to #34515 this software is broken:
> Also, moving to Visual Studio 2026 (Community edition) is currently not an option, it ships with a [unusable vcpkg version](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/10998815).

but I guess this doesn't effect us, or at least our usage in CI?

> Also, according to #34515 this software is broken:
> 
> > Also, moving to Visual Studio 2026 (Community edition) is currently not an option, it ships with a [unusable vcpkg version](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/10998815).
> 
> but I guess this doesn't effect us, or at least our usage in CI?

It [affects](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34515#issuecomment-3861729236) the builtin vcpkg that is recommended in our [docs](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/build-windows-msvc.md). The CI uses an alternative vcpkg installation.

Converted to draft.

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
ðŸ™ This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

events.body: Rebased to resolve a conflict with merged bitcoin/bitcoin#34500.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -219,10 +219,10 @@ jobs:
         include:
           - job-type: standard
             generate-options: '-DBUILD_BENCH=ON -DBUILD_KERNEL_LIB=ON -DBUILD_UTIL_CHAINSTATE=ON -DWERROR=ON'
-            job-name: 'Windows native, VS 2022'
+            job-name: 'Windows native, VS 2026'
           - job-type: fuzz
             generate-options: '-DVCPKG_MANIFEST_NO_DEFAULT_FEATURES=ON -DVCPKG_MANIFEST_FEATURES="wallet" -DBUILD_GUI=OFF -DWITH_ZMQ=OFF -DBUILD_FOR_FUZZING=ON -DWERROR=ON'
-            job-name: 'Windows native, fuzz, VS 2022'
+            job-name: 'Windows native, fuzz, VS 2026'
comments.body: could remove the version/year here, as the docs and presets should already be clear on it? (no other ci task is having the version/year in the title)
